page.title: 01Penketh and Great Sankey
page.content: These are two adjoining suburbs to the west of the industrial town of Warrington. The place name Penketh derives from the Old English words "Pen"meaning edge or top,and "Coed"meaning wood.The wood referred to is probably the nearby parish of Burtonwood,although there is no wood there in modern times. The place name Great Sankey is much more obscure in derivation.The Sankey Brook flows through the parish but little other evidence is available.The parish,unlike most others in the area has no frontage to the River Mersey,and is thus "Sans Quay",without a quay.
